text:
You place your hand upon the dying flame, and it does not burn — it *welcomes*. Your flesh cracks, your form distorts, but your will remains intact. You do not scream.

The world begins anew. Light returns to the sky, and the ruins breathe again. But behind every rebirth is a cost. Your name is forgotten. Your face is etched only in myth. You have become what all others once followed — a new bearer, a new beginning, a new fire.
lore: This is the ending chosen by those who cannot abide darkness. But every age of fire burns toward ash. What begins in flame ends in silence. And so the wheel turns again.
